attributes.action: Solve the gridlock occuring on the M5 between Almondsbury & Clevedon.
attributes.background: Due to the design of the Avonmouth Bridge, the 3 mile long queues to leave the M5 at junction 19 (Portishead) both morning and evening, repeated accidents between junctions 18 and 19, in part due to road design, inpart due to careless driving, life on the M5 is now intolerable.
attributes.additional_details: One needs only reference Inrix, view CCTV or stand on a bridge to see the chaos and misery caused to locals, commuter, holiday makers and businesses. Now is the time to design a 2nd Avonmouth crossing, take local traffic for Portishead off at junction 18 (or use a design similar to J5-6, M20), bulldoze Gordano services, redesign junction 19, put in SMART motorway, widen the carriageways and if necessary re-route the motorway for long distance traffic from junction 15 to a new junction 19A.

attributes.action: Give HMRC more funding to help stamp out tax evasion.
attributes.background: Tax fraud costs the government  £16bn every year. HMRC are making cuts to "save money" in reality these job losses are hurting the economy. Tax avoidance is hurting services like the NHS and is leading to low earning citizens having to pay higher taxes. Sign to make the government give more funding.

attributes.action: Due to its defence policy this house has no confidence in the government.
attributes.background:
The first duty of any government is the defence of the realm and its people.  The reports of the Commons Defence Select Committee and of Sir John Parker are ignored.
The Army Reserve is under strength.
In the UN we should be able to “Speak softly and carry a big stick”.
attributes.additional_details:
The Type 45's have not had their defects rectified. Our fleet is not able to defend our trade or undertake our world-wide duties. 
The army is  a militia.  Personnel have despicably been made redundant immediately qualifying for pension.  The RAF has too few A/C and no maritime reconnaissance capability.

attributes.action: Lower £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable to the citizens.
attributes.background:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
attributes.additional_details:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
• Work 7 days to earn the £350 a week no social life or time spent with family friends.
• Increase pay, reduce taxes or decrease the £18,600
• Work stress free with the weekend to your own self
• Let citizens live!

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Stop the spread of smart motorways
attributes.background: Stop the spread of the smart motorways throughout the country.They're clearly a money making scam an have done nothing but made the roads more dangerous.
attributes.additional_details: When they're on it's like driving through road works with no actual roadworks in place,because of too many motorist speeding up an slamming on aswel as making it more unsafe for anyone who has broken down.Changing the signs from 60,50,40,60,40 is clearly a way to catch people out an putting the 40 sign on at the bottom of a hill causes HGVs to use a lot more fuel to drag the load up the hill instead of maintaining speed.

attributes.action: Reduce fuel VAT to 5%
attributes.background: As energy VAT is at 5%; fuel such as petrol and diesel should also be reduced to 5% as they are also non-renewable energy sources.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Open Centres that provide Class A drugs like Heroin for free to prevent crime.
attributes.background: If there were Centers that provided class A drugs for free and a safe place to take them. Users Registered, agreed to treatment. Then Drug dealers would have no business, muggings, robberies and shoplifting would drop dramatically and few young people would start using.
attributes.additional_details: Open centres across the country. While keeping the sale and use of Heroin illegal elsewhere, in the Centres Heroin and other highly addictive class A drugs would be given to addicts that register and seek treatment. Over night drug dealers would be out of business, muggings, robbery’s, burglary’s and shop lifting would decrease dramatically as addicts no longer need to commit crime. Lastly, drug dealers wouldn’t be pushing drugs onto young naïve people in order to profit from their misery.

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Make tattoo discrimination illegal
attributes.background: Tattoo discrimination, especially in the work place, should be made illegal, judge people by their talent, not by looks

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: Introduce the drinking age of 21
attributes.background:
Alcohol has many side affects. It's scientifically proved that it can damage the devolving brain cells of the teenagers.
However the majority of 21 year old are fully developed, therefore the effects of alcohol upon the brain is significantly lower.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make dealing with panic attacks part of standard first aid courses/training
attributes.background: If we are going to treat mental health the same as any other illness or condition, it needs to be normalised and people need to be trained on how to manage a situation if someone has a panic attack. They are becoming increasingly common, particularly in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
At least 1 in 10 people suffer from panic attacks (NHS) - meaning on average at least 1 person in every small business may be a sufferer. Many people will be afraid of the symptoms which can be similar to those of a heart attack - so people need to be made aware of the tell-tale signs and how to manage them.
Hours of work are lost from anxiety related issues, so let's make our nation more open to talk and comfortable when dealing with anxiety and panic attacks.

attributes.action: Adopt British summer Time from mid February to mid November.
attributes.background:
Almost nobody looks forward to the clocks going back, at the end of October, and despite this, we persist with this oppressive schedule.  
My proposal is to adopt BST from Mid Feb to mid Nov. shortening the dark winter evenings.  I believe this would be very good for national morale.
attributes.additional_details:
It is said that the mornings are too dark in Scotland.  On the current regime, it is broad daylight in Edinburgh at 8.00 am by the end of January.  As a Scot, I am sure that mid February would be a good moment to move to BST.  It is a long haul through to the end of March. 
 
Light at the end of the day is far more useful for healthy recreation and exercise, and environmentally, less energy would be used with lighter evenings, because more people are up and about in the afternoon.

attributes.action: All cyclist road users must have insurance and a cycling licence to use the road
attributes.background: As a car owner I have had incidents at the fault of a cyclist.  Damage was caused to my vehicle but because cyclist are uninsured I was unable to call any authority to pay for the damages.  Cyclists can note our registration and go to the police at any time who can then contact our insurance
attributes.additional_details: I was indicating to turn right but waiting for oncoming traffic to give way.  Cyclist overtook on my drivers side knocking my wing mirror off, dent and scratched my door.  Asked why he done that, he answered "sorry my fault, I thought I could get around in time"!  I stayed with him made sure he was OK called the ambulance. A few weeks later I received a letter from Metropolitan Police regarding the incident! I had to pay for the damages to my car although it was not my fault!

attributes.action: Do not cut NHS unsociable hours pay.
attributes.background:
There is talk about fresh contracts to be implemented for the rest of the NHS staff. Due to the national shortage of healthcare professionals and workers, it would not be feasible to cut pay further. 
A lot of NHS staff rely on unsociable hours pay, to feed their families and so forth.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS needs a revamp and a boost, but not at the expense of front-line staff. It is not ideal to venture down this path and it would be an idea to explore other options, as opposed to cutting people's pay. The NHS also needs to encourage future employees and this is a solution, to a recruitment problem.

attributes.action: Change abortion laws. Abortions should only be up until week 15 no later.
attributes.background: U.K Abortion laws should be reduced to 15 weeks unless a threat to the baby or mothers health. This gives women plenty of time to make up their mind about their choice. Provide more sexual health education instead and provide free contraception to schools and GPs.
attributes.additional_details: Some babies have survived abortions and some babies have been born premature and have survived from as early as week 20 yet our law permits abortion til week 24. Provide better support for women in sexual relations instead with better sexual health education, free contraception and guidance counselling or some sort of help with personal development and relationships. Encourage adoption instead. Fund better antenatal support. Give free counselling support to victims of rape instead.

attributes.action: Free sanitary products for public restrooms so homeless women can still get them
attributes.background: Homeless woman are less likely to get these products as they will have to choose between food or these products, if we had free ones in public restrooms it would help them in the long run.

attributes.action: Ban Zero Hour Contracts and ensure all employers offer 10 hours per week minimum
attributes.background: Employers are still taking on staff with zero hour contracts, meaning a large portion of the UK workforce has no idea what their income will be from one week to the next. Not only this, these jobs are often paid at the minimum wage which often makes life very hard for honest working people.

attributes.action: The abuse of a redhead should be made a criminal offence as a form of racism.
attributes.background:
It's racial abuse and harrassment and works the same as being harassed for having a different colour skin or having a different god. 
It is an 'accepted' form of abuse in society which is wrong as this amount of bullying and mental abuse is dangerous for a person's insecurities or mental health.
attributes.additional_details: I am a strong believer in this being a form of racism and I will never believe it is okay for people to be tortured for being different. People get trauma treatment and counselling due to insecurities and mental illness triggered by the abuse and harassment. People can be rejected from work, friendships, relationships and school events for it. It can have a long lasting impact on those affected and even lead people to suicide.

attributes.action: Ban the release of Helium balloons
attributes.background:
Helium is a rare gas, which is becoming scarce, we allow people to release helium filled balloons for memorials/ celebrations / competitions. 
It causes major problems when the balloons deflate for wildlife and in particular aquatic animals. A number of whale deaths are recently attributed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://balloonsblow.org/
http://www.nabas.co.uk/about-balloons/
http://www.abc.net.au/science/surfingscientist/heliumballoons.htm
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/how-balloon-releases-harm-wildlife/
http://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

They are becoming part of the plastic soup we dump into out oceans killing wildlife we cannot continue like this, it a simple start please sign.

attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: Make it law that all members of Parliament take regular drug and alcohol tests.
attributes.background: The government are accountable to the people and as most companies now test for drugs and alcohol so should Parliament as they shouldn't be running as ministers if under the influence

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for farmers and food producers to use antibiotics routinely.
attributes.background: Antibiotic resistance is a major health problem. Much is caused by routine feeding or injecting of livestock to improve yields. This has stopped many antibiotics from working causing dangerous patient health issues and increased NHS costs. This resistance threatens ALL antibiotic effectiveness.
attributes.additional_details: While there might be occasions when farm animals need antibiotics to treat specific illnesses, the wholesale use can only increase the risk of the evolution of resistant bacterial strains with fatal human consequences.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Create a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction.
attributes.background: M25 is a nightmare for commuters especially during peak hours. Commuters waste precious time sitting in long traffic queues around the  junctions such as J27, J21, J16, J15, J12 and Dartford crossing. Traffic on M25 is also adding to vehicular pollution.
attributes.additional_details: Creating a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction would ease the traffic on M25 and reduce vehicular pollution. This outer circle can then connect to all major train line that go into the Central London areas or going to other areas of the Country. Ample parking in these train stations will allow commuters to drive into the nearest station and hop onto trains. Local businesses around the train station will also benefit from the new investment.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: Allow Armed forces personal to carry side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.background: Due to the fact there gave been person's attempting abductions against our service personnel it is time to allow them to carry loaded side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.additional_details: RAF Marham. Aldershot

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the World’s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: To enforce that the CMS deal with both maintenance & contact thorough mediation
attributes.background: For the CMS to enforce that mediation must be attended by both parents in exchange for their  services. Both contact and maintenance are discussed and put to the courts. Solicitors and mediatiors can attend. Saving so much trouble and heart ache.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last two years I have gone through great troubles to arrange contact with my son Lucas. Since going through this I have noticed that there are several people going through the same... Alienation, unfair judgement in court, expensive solicitors. The CMS has sonics  legal power to peruse the money but don't do the same for contact. Making it easier to seperate a non living parent from their child with no obligation to maintain a healthy relationship between them. This must be stopped .

attributes.action: Road works on motorways should require 24/7 working.
attributes.background: Road works on motorways and major public roads should have 24/7 working to reduce loss of trade to local business and increased inconvenience to the UK population. The UK will be globally more effective and prosperous if the UK's transport links are more efficient.
attributes.additional_details: A short term pain, will lead to a long term gain.

attributes.action: Help London workers and locals be home owners: restrict multi-property buying.
attributes.background: London house prices keep soaring, and only wealthy UK and foreign investors benefit as they buy up the capital, at prices only they can afford. Home owning is unattainable for locals and workers living in the capital, making renting their only option. Again, rents are high and saving to buy is hard.
attributes.additional_details:
Laws need to be put into place to restrict mass buying from wealthy individuals, as well control on companies.
London is driven by its workers/locals but house prices are causing people to leave to other cities. Plus those commuting into London are being pushed further out as the outskirts also become unaffordable. 
This petition urges the Government implement laws to help more people become home owners in the Capital, and restrict the benefits to investors raking in ridiculous rental income!

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: Review on Police Cautions
attributes.background: Police Cautions are to be used as an alternative to prosecution in minor cases. However they are so frequently used that people who accept them are unaware of the future implications of having a caution. Regulations & review on the dispensation of a police caution and length on a record is required.
attributes.additional_details:
It has become increasingly apparent the implications of a police caution and unfortunately it is not realised until it is too late. The bodies able to dispense a caution, police and CPS, often work together and it is a biased system in that those who investigate also give the reprimand.
The following links shed some light on this matter.
http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-cautions-from-crb/
https://iaingould.co.uk/2013/06/03/a-caution-is-for-life-not-just-for-christmas/

attributes.action: Compel Bacs to process payments over a maximum 1-day execution time
attributes.background: In 2007 the EU declared rapid payments essential for a modern and properly functioning economy, adding that there is no reason why payments should not be made by the end of the next business day at the latest. Why, then, nine years later, does Bacs still take three days to process payments?
attributes.additional_details: In 2016, 3-day payments should be redundant. For an electronic payment to take 3 days to process is unacceptable. A cheque which clears on the fourth day is barely any slower. And yet, Bacs is the only option for direct debits, the only RTI-enabled option for payroll payments, and the entrenched option for all other payments. There was no reason in 2007, and there remains no reason today, why all these payments should not be processed over a maximum 1-day execution time, by default.

attributes.action: Hold a voter registration and information day in all schools for 16 year olds.
attributes.background: We are lucky enough to live in a peaceful, democratic country, where each and every citizen has a say in who runs the country. The importance of taking part in democracy and voting cannot be stressed enough, yet information and education on the importance of voting is minimal.
attributes.additional_details: Too often the 18-24 year old demographic has amongst the lowest turnout in elections and referendums. The importance of voting cannot be overstated, yet there is little information on the process and importance of participating in democracy for young adults. Should 16 year olds be able to register to vote in their final year of secondary education they will have two years to learn about our democracy and consider their views, before being eligible to vote at 18.

attributes.action: Investigate the Use of an Oral TB Vaccine for Badgers.
attributes.background: The US are saving an endangered species of ferret from Sylvatic plague using an oral vaccine deployed in food. Can we adapt these ideas and find an oral TB vaccine for badgers with a food we can deploy near setts for them to eat?
attributes.additional_details:
I Googled oral TB vaccine and found there is one for humans and it's more effective than the jab.Oral TB Vaccine: 

http://www.australasianscience.com.au/article/issue-december-2012/oral-tb-vaccine-better-needle.html

The main objection to vaccination has always been the difficulty in trapping and injection. This solves that problem.

Ferret Vaccination Details: http://www.theverge.com/2016/7/12/12161792/ferret-candy-vaccine-drones-montana

attributes.action: Use £23.4 billion  Trident costs to feed, protect and educate our children.
attributes.background: Every year the poorest people in Britain are asked to support other poor people by donating to children in need etc.  We ask that the money for Trident be spent to protect vulnerable children and that those who want Trident hold a telethon to raise money for it.
attributes.additional_details: People of all ages, but especially children are suffering and living in unacceptable poverty whilst hard working tax payers watch their money being spent on weapons of mass destruction that aren't wanted and will never be used.  This must change.

attributes.action: Use motorway matrix signs to say "Keep left unless overtaking."
attributes.background: This could be used where appropriate to remind drivers that are driving in centre lanes to move over. Thus helping traffic flow.
